description: Shigeru Ishiba, Japan's prime minister and president of the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), at the party's headquarters following the lower house election, at the party's headquarters in Tokyo, Japan, on Sunday, Oct. 27, 2024. Japan’s Liberal Democratic Party is set to lose its majority in Sunday’s election, according to a forecast from public broadcaster NHK, leaving in the balance whether the ruling coalition will hold on to power.
title: 衆議院選挙の結果と金融市場の反応

description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said his government would “embrace the harsh light of fiscal reality,” as Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves prepares to reveal a historic package of tax hikes and extra borrowing in a make-or-break budget on Wednesday.
title: Keir Starmer to Embrace ‘Harsh Light of Fiscal Reality’ in Key Budget

description: Lithuania’s Social Democratic Party secured a victory in parliamentary elections after adding more seats in the second round of voting and will now try to forge a governing alliance.
title: Lithuanian Social Democrats Set to Win Second Round of Elections

description: Trade-tracking data show that the Indian firm is selling top-end Dell servers optimized for artificial intelligence to Russia.
title: How a Mumbai Drugmaker Is Helping Putin Get Nvidia AI Chips

description: Bolivian authorities will investigate an alleged attack directed at former President Evo Morales that took place Sunday as the Andean nation faces a deep political crisis.
title: Bolivia to Probe Alleged Attack Against Former Leader Morales

description: The French government plans to crack down on absenteeism in the civil service and reduce development aid as part of a series of measures aimed at delivering €5 billion ($5.4 billion) of spending cuts in next year’s budget.
title: French Government Targets Absenteeism in Hunt for Spending Cuts

description: Bulgaria’s influential former Prime Minister Boyko Borissov has won the country’s seventh vote in less than four years, but will fall short of a majority needed to end political paralysis, exit polls showed.
title: Borissov’s Gerb Wins Bulgarian Snap Vote, Exit Poll Shows

description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba must quickly cobble together additional support for his administration if he is to survive as leader, following the first defeat for the ruling coalition since 2009.
title: Ishiba Needs to Find Friends Fast After Japan Election Setback

description: Vice President Kamala Harris kicked off the last full week of campaigning at a church in Philadelphia in her latest bid to energize Black voters, while former President Donald Trump is betting on a famous New York City venue — Madison Square Garden — to give him a final-stretch push on Sunday evening.
title: Harris Woos Minority Votes in Philadelphia; Trump in NYC

description: Ontario plans to extend a temporary cut to gasoline and diesel taxes to next June, Premier Doug Ford said at a news conference Sunday.
title: Ontario to Extend Gas Tax Cut Through June 2025, Premier Says

description: Japan’s Liberal Democratic Party and its coalition partner are set to lose their majority in Sunday’s election, according to a forecast from public broadcaster NHK, raising questions about the future of Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba.
title: Japan’s Ruling Coalition to Lose Majority in Election, NHK Says

description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves will not unveil any new freeports across the UK in her budget this week, the Financial Times reported.
title: UK’s Reeves Will Not Unveil New Freeports in Budget, FT Says

description: Hungarian premier Viktor Orban is planning a trip to Georgia as early as this coming Monday, according to people familiar with the matter, following an election with high geopolitical stakes for the Caucasus republic.
title: Orban Planning Trip to Georgia Following Divisive Elections

description: Republican vice presidential candidate JD Vance said Donald Trump would keep the US in NATO if reelected, though it’s important that the trans-Atlantic alliance isn’t “just a welfare client.”
title: Vance Says Trump Would Keep US in NATO, Germany Needs to Step Up

description: Japan’s Liberal Democratic Party is set to lose its majority in Sunday’s election, according to a forecast from public broadcaster NHK, leaving in the balance whether the ruling coalition will hold on to power.
title: Japan’s Ruling Party Set to Lose Majority for the First Time Since 2009, Exit Poll Shows

description: Former President Donald Trump is launching the last full week of the US election with what his campaign is touting as a grand extravaganza – a rally to top all others — at Madison Square Garden in New York City.
title: Trump Eyes MAGA Spectacle for Deep-Blue New York in Final Push

description: Russia continues a slow, grinding advance across the entire frontline in Ukraine as a close US election looms whose result will have major repercussions for Kyiv’s ability to fight back.
title: As US Vote Nears, Ukraine’s Allies Worry About What Comes Next

description: Georgia’s opposition is disputing the results of Saturday’s parliamentary elections, which are being led by the ruling party and could determine the country’s chances of joining the European Union and NATO.
title: Georgia Opposition Disputes Vote Results as Ruling Party Leads

description: China said it filed a diplomatic complaint with the US and reserved the right to retaliate after the latest American weapons sales to Taiwan, escalating tensions in their dispute over the archipelago.
title: China Warns US It Will Respond to Latest Taiwan Weapons Sales

description: Bulgaria will vote in a snap parliamentary election on Sunday that is expected to deepen a political stalemate in one of the European Union’s poorest and most corrupt nations.
title: Bulgaria Votes Again After Four Years of Deadlock: What to Watch
